page.title: 09 BUILDINGS IN E.BUDLEIGH (2)
page.content: 1.{Hayes Barton}This large thatched farmhouse was the birthplace of Sir Walter Raleigh(1552-1618).Raleigh tried to buy the land in 1584-unsuccessfully. There are memorials to the Raleigh family in E.Budleigh church. 2.{Otterton Mill}Mentioned in the first Domesday Book,this restored watermill is now an important tourist centre.As well as a permanent display on Honiton Lace,there are varying exhibitions,a woodcarver & potter.(in Otterton). 3.{E.Budleigh Church}A fine 15C church. The list of vicars goes back to 1261 & there are memorials to the Raleigh family.Of interest are 63 carved bench- ends dating to the 16C. 4.{Salem Chapel}Situated between E.Bud- leigh & Otterton,this is an original "Five mile" Chapel. 5.{St.Mary's Church}Built on the Bicton Estate with memorials to the Rolles.
